intro: Pleurothallis biriricensis, commonly known as the Cusco orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Peru. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, pseudobulbous structure. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow, typically blooming during the dry season. It thrives in high-altitude environments with high humidity and partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
